data.text: Contents
Introduction

The purpose of this document is to provide a framework for competent registered nursing staff (RN'S) to facilitate effective, timely and safe nurse led discharge across the trust for paediatric patients.

The Department of Health (2004) considers that up to 80% of discharges can be carried out by registered nursing staff. They state changing the way a patient is discharged can improve patient flow and facilitate effective use of bed capacity. This will assist in improving the patient experience by helping ensure that patients, parents/carers are fully informed and reduces delays.
The introduction of a toolkit ‘Achieving timely ‘simple' discharge from hospital' (DOH 2004a) reasserted and embraced the nurse's role in discharge.

The use of Criteria-led discharge (CLD) will provide competent RNs in all paediatric areas within Mid and South Essex trusts (MSE), to facilitate a patient's discharge from hospital, based on the use of an agreed criteria and clinical parameters guided by the senior medical team.
Scope
The purpose of this document is to:
Provide both registered nursing and senior medical staff with the guidance and competencies to facilitate a CLD for those patients considered appropriate (Appendix 2)
Improve the patient experience for children, young people and their parent/carers, allowing them to be discharged without further medical review when deemed appropriate

Increase bed availability through prompt discharge across all paediatric areas (inpatient, paediatric assessment units (PAU) and paediatric emergency departments) and increase direct admissions to the right speciality across the Trust
Promote effective inter-disciplinary working, by making effective use of nursing knowledge and skills
Reduce complaints relating to delays in timely discharge from parent/carers.
Definitions

table_items.text: Paediatric Assessment Unit, Children's Assessment unit
Speciality Registrar on core medical training

data.text: Role and responsibilities within the Trust
Director of Nursing/Medical Director

The paediatric governance group for the MSE are responsible for ensuring clinical guidelines are evidence-based and developed in accordance with national guidance, whilst following appropriate consultation with all stakeholders involved in the process
Heads of Nursing/Matrons
The Paediatric Heads of Nursing are responsible for ensuring the implementation at departmental level of this policy across the paediatric directorate of the MSE
Consultant/SPR/CMT/Middle Grade
Will be familiar with this policy and understand the responsibilities and processes involved in undertaking CLD within paediatric departments

Will complete the necessary CLD paperwork (appendix 1), document in the patient medical records and communicate in a timely manner with identified RN's who have undertaken the competencies (appendix 2)
Practice Educators (PE)/Practice Clinical Facilitators (PCF) and Senior Registered Nursing Staff at Departmental Levels
Will identify appropriate nursing staff who can facilitate discharge following completion of the competencies (Appendix 2)
Will maintain up to date records of staff competencies
Registered Nursing Staff
All practitioners authorised to undertake CLD within paediatric areas must be a registered nurse of minimum 2 years' experience who has undertaken the competencies (Appendix 2)
Demonstrates a good understanding of the patient deemed medically stable for discharge under the CLD process
Process for undertaking criteria led discharge

All patients deemed suitable for CLD should have this documented in the patient medical records by the senior medical team. This must include that the patient is medically fit/stable for discharge once the set of clinical criteria has been met (Appendix 1)
A treatment plan must be recorded in the healthcare records, and outline specific parameters for results, observations and clinical condition which must be met before discharge under CLD (Appendix 1)
The senior medical team will have reviewed the patient within the last  hours and deemed they are safe for CLD if all targets are met
The senior medical team will have completed the necessary TTA's. Discharge letter and any required follow-up in when CLD is identified to prevent any delay.
Patients/Carers must be provided with information about criteria-led discharge/the care pathway
Criteria Led Discharges will be actioned by the designated Registered Nurse

If any of the criteria is not met, the designated senior nurse is to seek medical advice of a registrar or consultant. In this occurrence, documentation in medical notes should explain why the patient has not met CLD and where and whom medical advice was sort from
Basildon only - Discharges on EPR can be recorded as CLD(short stay patients in PAU)
Exclusions to CLD:
Patients with safeguarding issues
Patients who have clinically deteriorated since CLD was commenced
Training requirements

Senior Nurses will identify those members of staff who are eligible for undertaking CLD in each department and will complete the competency document with them. Training records will be maintained by each department and a copy of the document should be kept by the RN for their own professional records
Monitoring and audit
Outlined below is the Trust's process of monitoring compliance with, and the effectiveness of the document's main points

table_items.text: Aspect of compliance or effectiveness being monitored
Individual department responsible for the monitoring
Group / Committee / forum which will receive the findings/monitoring report
Committee / individual responsible for ensuring the actions are completed
Retrospecti ve audit of patients fitting criteria
Ward Manager s and PE/PCF Team
Site and MSE governance groups and audit meetings

data.text: Key performance indicators to be monitored through audit:
Has length of stay decreased
What are the readmission rates for these patients
Documentation and paperwork correctly completed
Approval and implementation
Each paediatric area will have CLD implemented by both the Paediatric Consultants and Senior Nursing team, demonstrating to staff the process and benefits of using CLD

All policies, procedures and guidelines will be approved by the MSE paediatric governance committee which is the specialist group with the authority to approve local CLD guidelines. These will then be forwarded to the Document control team for submission and ratification by the Joint Document Management Group
It is the author's responsibility to inform the paediatric departments of the approved policy documents when they are uploaded to the Trust's Intranets
Equality impact assessment
The Trust is committed to the provision of a service that is fair, accessible and meets the needs of all individuals
(Refer to appendix 3)

Appendix 2: Criteria led discharge competencies

table_items.text: Prior to this assessment, the registered nurse must have read the Criteria Led Discharge Policy for Paediatrics. Only Registered Nurses who have minimum two years' experience can be signed as CLD Competent It is the staff member's responsibility to ensure they feel competent in using the CLD process
Discuss the responsibilities of the CLD process for discharge
Be able to explain accountability of undertaking CLD
Be familiar and able to discuss the discharge in relation to the CLD pathway
Identify and effectively use resources available to support safe Discharge using CLD
Has completed online e-learning and Safeguarding children Level 3
Is confident in recognition of the deteriorating child and is able to revoke the CLD if unhappy to discharge and escalate concerns to senior doctor
Able to liaise with outside agencies e.g. Community nursing Team, asthma Nurse, health visitor
Is able to understand responsibilities in relation to documentation and has read the NMC Guidelines for record keeping
Recognise when to refer the patient back to the medical team for further review if they have any concerns about patient safety at discharge

table_items.text: ☐ A change in a service to patients
☒ A change to an existing document
☒ A change to the way staff work
What are you proposing to change?
Implementation of the Criteria Led Discharge process in all paediatric areas of the MSE
Why are you making this change? (What will the change achieve?)
To facilitate timely discharges with patients who meet the safe criteria which will benefit patient flow and bed availability across the MSE
Who benefits from this change and how?

Patients and their parents/carers Paediatric medical team – reduce workload for patients who can be discharged by competent RN's RN's for inter-professional working and recognition of ability to assess and safely discharge using CLD
Is anyone likely to suffer any negative impact as a result of this change? If no, please record reasons here and sign and date this assessment. If yes, please complete a full EIA.
a) Will you be undertaking any consultation as part of this change?
Yes; All paediatric medical and nursing staff across the MSE
